medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent severe hypertriglyceridemia (HTG) with recurrent pancreatitis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Onset of FCS symptoms typically occurs in childhood or adolescence. The female twin experienced abdominal discomfort attributed to a viral illness at age 13, followed by appendectomy at age 15 and oophorectomy at age 18. HTG was not identified until she was hospitalized for acute pancreatitis during her first pregnancy at age 20. Male siblings were diagnosed during routine examinations in their late teens, with the male twin having his first pancreatitis episode around the same time. The older brother had occasional abdominal discomfort until his first pancreatitis episode at age 35.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Homozygous lipoprotein lipase (LPL) mutation identified; history of recurrent pancreatitis.
medical_history.family_history: Siblings affected with familial chylomicronemia syndrome, offspring of a first-cousin marriage.
